subject: Re: New review (2★) of Simsonn VAM Pro Linear Motor - the Pedals Haptic Reactor for Vibration Feedback (from Tobias H.)
description_text:
Thank you for your message.

I would like to clarify whether the SIMSONN ProX Ultra control box is also compatible with the standard SIMSONN ProX pedals—specifically, whether I can connect throttle, brake, and clutch to it.
If that is the case, I would be very interested in upgrading to the newer control box in order to take full advantage of the VAM Pro's capabilities.

Unfortunately, it was not clear during the purchase process that the original ProX control box does not support the VAM Pro's full functionality.
Since I specifically purchased the vibration motors to explore their potential, this limitation was unexpected.

For context: I had ordered the motors as a test product to gather hands-on experience for my SimRacing webshop SimWelten.de.
I planned to share my insights with customers and was considering adding the motors to our product portfolio based on performance and integration.

I would appreciate your feedback regarding the control box compatibility and whether an upgrade path is available.

Best regards

Tobias Hoffer

SimWelten.de

service@simsonn.com <service@simsonn.com> schrieb am Dienstag, 29. Juli 2025 um 17:12:

> Hi Tobias H.,
>
> Please confirm whether your software has been updated to SIMSONN Manager 2.1.0 and that your firmware is the latest version.
> Kindly provide a screenshot of the software interface for our reference.
> In addition, please let us know the brand of your wheelbase, as some models may cause interference.
> We also recommend connecting the USB cable directly to the rear USB 3.0 (blue) port of your computer instead of using a USB hub, as disconnections can prevent the VAM from receiving stop commands in time, resulting in continuous vibration.
>
> In addition, if your pedal is a ProX, it does not support bidirectional motion, so when using the VAM Pro, its vibration strength is much lower compared to the PlusX and ProX Ultra control boxes.
> At the same time, our VAM Pro has superior tested thrust compared to the Simagic HPR: Simagic provides 0.4 kg, while our VAM Pro delivers 0.7 kg of thrust.
>
>> On Tue, 29 Jul at 11:01 AM , Loox <no-reply@loox.io> wrote:
>>
>> Rating: 2 | Review Text: I’m using both the VAM and the VAM Pro, and to me, the regular VAM feels noticeably stronger than the VAM Pro. I previously used the Simagic HPM Haptic – which looks very similar to the VAM Pro – but in my opinion, it felt significantly more powerful. Another issue I’m facing, especially in LMU, is that some effects get stuck. For example, when I brake into a corner, the ABS feedback kicks in and then just keeps running, even when it shouldn't. On top of that, I barely feel any difference between 20% and 100% power settings on the VAM Pro. All of this unfortunately affects the overall experience for me.
>>

>> from Tobias Hoffer [tobias.hoffer@proton.me](mailto:tobias.hoffer@proton.me?body=Review:%20I%E2%80%99m%20using%20both%20the%20VAM%20and%20the%20VAM%20Pro%2C%20and%20to%20me%2C%20the%20regular%20VAM%20feels%20noticeably%20stronger%20than%20the%20VAM%20Pro.%20I%20previously%20used%20the%20Simagic%20HPM%20Haptic%20%E2%80%93%20which%20looks%20very%20similar%20to%20the%20VAM%20Pro%20%E2%80%93%20but%20in%20my%20opinion%2C%20it%20felt%20significantly%20more%20powerful.%20Another%20issue%20I%E2%80%99m%20facing%2C%20especially%20in%20LMU%2C%20is%20that%20some%20effects%20get%20stuck.%20For%20example%2C%20when%20I%20brake%20into%20a%20corner%2C%20the%20ABS%20feedback%20kicks%20in%20and%20then%20just%20keeps%20running%2C%20even%20when%20it%20shouldn't.%20On%20top%20of%20that%2C%20I%20barely%20feel%20any%20difference%20between%2020%25%20and%20100%25%20power%20settings%20on%20the%20VAM%20Pro.%20All%20of%20this%20unfortunately%20affects%20the%20overall%20experience%20for%20me.)
>>
>> [Tobias Hoffer](http://tobias.hoffer@proton.me)
>> Display name: Tobias H.
>>
>> I’m using both the VAM and the VAM Pro, and to me, the regular VAM feels noticeably stronger than the VAM Pro. I previously used the Simagic HPM Haptic – which looks very similar to the VAM Pro – but in my opinion, it felt significantly more powerful. Another issue I’m facing, especially in LMU, is that some effects get stuck. For example, when I brake into a corner, the ABS feedback kicks in and then just keeps running, even when it shouldn't. On top of that, I barely feel any difference between 20% and 100% power settings on the VAM Pro. All of this unfortunately affects the overall experience for me.
>>
